review: I purchased the Chromecast about a month ago and have been pleased so far with the exception of the wifi range. The manual tells you to have it within 20 feet of your wireless router and this is very important to avoid premature hair loss. When I first tried to setup the Chromecast I had a real problem getting it to connect to my wireless network. The tv I was using it on was upstairs and my router was downstairs. Without measuring the distance between the two I figured I was probably close to the 20 foot recommendation so I ended up plugging the Chromecast into my downstairs tv which sits within a couple feet of the router and no surprise it connected immediately with no issues. After connecting to my network I took the Chromecast back up stairs and plugged it in and it worked immediately.I have used the Chromecast to stream Netflix, HBOGO, YouTube, and Pandora. The only issues I have had is some slight buffering (probably due the the distance between the Chromecast and the router) and a couple of times I've had to unplug it and plug it back in because it wouldn't respond to commands from our devices but other than those minor issues I have been very pleased overall.I would recommend the Chromecast for anyone who needs an expensive device to stream video.
